title: MEDICAL RECORDS – Adds to existing law to require the provision of copies of medical records in certain circumstances.
subject: HEALTH
HEALTH CARE FACILITIES
HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONS AND PROVIDERS
MEDICAL
RECORDS

actions.description: Introduced; read first time; referred to JR for Printing
Reported Printed; referred to Health & Welfare
Reported out of committee; to 14th Order for amendment
Placed in the Committee of the Whole
Reported out without recommendation, as amended
Amendments ordered printed; referred for engrossment
Reported engrossed, filed for first reading, as amended
Read first time as amended, filed for Second Reading
Read second time as amended, filed for Third reading

Read third time in full as amended – PASSED - 19-16-0AYES – Adams, Blaylock, Burtenshaw, Cook, Den Hartog, Foreman, Galloway, Guthrie, Keyser, Lent, Rabe, Ricks, Ruchti, Semmelroth, Taylor, VanOrden, Ward-Engelking, Wintrow, WoodwardNAYS – Anthon, Bernt, Bjerke, Carlson, Grow, Harris, Hart, Kohl, Lakey, Lenney, Nichols, Okuniewicz, Shippy, Toews, Zito, ZuiderveldAbsent and excused – NoneFloor Sponsor - RicksTitle apvd - to House
Received from the Senate, Filed for First Reading
Read First Time, Referred to Health & Welfare
Reported out of Committee with Do Pass Recommendation, Filed for Second Reading
Read second time; Filed for Third Reading

Read Third Time in Full – FAILED - 28-42-0AYES – Achilles, Berch, Cheatum, Church, Egbert, Erickson, Fuhriman, Furniss, Galaviz, Gannon, Garner, Green(Lesmeister), Handy, Healey, Manwaring, Mathias, McCann, Miller, Nelsen, Petzke, Raybould, Raymond, Rubel, Sauter, Vander Woude, Weber, Wheeler, Mr. SpeakerNAYS – Alfieri, Andrus, Barbieri, Beiswenger, Boyle, Bruce, Burgoyne, Cannon, Cayler, Clow, Cornilles, Crane(12), Crane(13), Dygert, Ehardt, Ehlers, Harris, Hawkins, Hill, Holtzclaw, Horman, Hostetler, Leavitt, Marmon, Mendive, Mickelsen, Mitchell, Monks, Palmer, Pickett, Pohanka, Price, Rasor, Redman, Scott, Shepherd, Shirts, Skaug, Tanner(13), Tanner(14), Thompson, WisniewskiAbsent – NoneFloor Sponsor - WheelerOrder ret’d to Senate
